hero.title: KBG — Kamand Bioengineering Group
hero.subtitle: An interdisciplinary student club at IIT Mandi exploring the frontiers of biology, engineering, and technology.
hero.description: From biomimetic design challenges to AI-driven bio-models, KBG blends biology with computation, hardware, and creative engineering. Join us to build projects, attend workshops, and collaborate across disciplines that shape the future of bioinnovation.

highlights.title: 12 active projects
highlights.text: From biosensing systems and neural cellular automata to bio-AI simulators and optimization toolkits — all developed by interdisciplinary teams.

highlights.title: 30+ events hosted
highlights.text: Hands-on workshops, technical talks, design challenges, and hackathons bridging biology with computing and engineering.

highlights.title: 5 collaborating labs
highlights.text: Active collaborations with IIT Mandi research labs and student technical clubs, driving open-source bioengineering innovation.

sections.title: Why Bioengineering — now
sections.copy: Biotechnology, data science, and engineering are converging faster than ever before. KBG empowers students to work at this intersection — where circuits meet cells, and algorithms meet ecosystems. Through structured events and project-based learning, we make research accessible and innovation collaborative.

sections.title: Studio-based learning
sections.copy: Each project cycle combines design thinking, experimentation, data analysis, and presentation. You’ll move from ideation to prototype through hands-on learning and cross-domain collaboration.
bullets: AI-assisted modeling and visualization for biological systems
Collaborative build sessions and mentorship from peers

sections.title: Shared infrastructure
sections.copy: KBG members get access to shared lab tools, maker-space facilities, open-source resources, and collaboration opportunities across IIT Mandi’s technical clubs and labs.

tracks.title: AI × Biology
tracks.summary: Leverage data-driven models to interpret biological patterns and optimize life-inspired systems.
focus: Neural Cellular Automata and generative bio-simulations

tracks.title: Biomimetics & Robotics
tracks.summary: Design mechanisms inspired by nature — from microfluidics to autonomous, swarm-inspired systems.
focus: Hardware-driven experiments with Arduino and Raspberry Pi

tracks.title: Environmental & Synthetic Systems
tracks.summary: Explore sustainability through synthetic biology, environmental modeling, and engineered ecosystems.

stories.quote: Designing a self-organizing growth model taught me how biology and computation can create art that literally evolves.
stories.author: Tanya Sharma

stories.quote: We simulated swarm behavior in HIVE — watching virtual agents move like living colonies was surreal.
stories.author: Rohit Verma

stories.quote: KBG made me realize how biology can be engineered — not just studied. Every build feels like a discovery.
stories.author: Aisha Khan

contact.headline: Let’s build something bioengineering × AI
contact.description: Reach out to collaborate, propose a project, or host a session with us. We welcome ideas that combine biology with technology and creativity.
